fields.description:
We are behind a corporate firewall and therefore cannot make direct SSH connections to our Stash server.
So we need to use a Proxy for SSH connections. With PuTTY/Plink this works by creating a profile for the host with the Proxy settings.

[https://monkeyswithbuttons.wordpress.com/2010/10/01/ssh-proxycommand-and-putty/]
[https://blog.terminal.com/setting-up-putty-with-terminals-ssh-proxy/]

After settings PuTTY up like described in the articles above I am able to git clone repositories from the command line via SSH through our proxy.
Anyways, trying to clone the same repositories in SourceTree will result in an network connection error.

Couldn't figure out why it does not work with SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores PuTTY/Plink Proxy settings

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the option to hide merged branches from the remotes list.

This would be similar to how the Bitbucket website shows active branches.
fields.summary: Hide merged branches from remotes list

fields.description:
Merging from master to feature branch. One file has been deleted on master, but is modified on the branch's HEAD. Notification is given in detailed merge feedback. In the Log/History view, the file in question is marked with an orange exclamation mark in staged and unstaged areas.

Right-clicking and selecting "Resolve conflicts -> Launch external merge tool" (I am using Beyond Compare, but not sure that is significant) results in the following:
 - The four helper files are created; BACKUP, BASE, LOCAL, REMOTE. The latter is empty.
 - The merge information dialog pops up, stating that you need to QUIT the merge tool to complete the merge process

... and that's all.

No merge tool is launched, and no other message appears.

I assume this may have something to do with the empty REMOTE revision.

To resolve it, I had to clean up by first aborting the ST merge dialog and removing the helper files in unstaged, and then notice that the file in question was gone on the incoming changes. Finally, I "merged" it by Removing (Ctrl-Del) it from unstaged, which supposedly recreated the situation on the other branch, and correctly ended up with a."deleted" mark on the staged file.
fields.summary: External merge tool failure when resolving deleted file

fields.description:
Hello,

recently I have the problem that I cannot upgrade or deinstall my sourcetree.

I get the error message "Another instance of setup is alredy running"

I have 3 sourcetree installed on my system, they must have accumulated due to the automatic updates.
fields.summary: Installer corrupted

fields.description:
I have Mercurial 3.2.3 installed as part of the installations which was done at the time the PC was built

I updated to Mercurial 4 as the System version 

Try selecting Use System Mercurial and the dialog pops up about the old version and after clicking ok nothing happens

Try to update Embedded - Machine is behind a proxy; proxy settings are correct and I get a Proxy authentication required error after putting in proxy details to the dialog which pops up. Went through resetting proxy password in general configuration and it still fails.
fields.summary: Mercurial out of date and update doesn't work

fields.description: I am trying to install the embedded git-lfs for Sourcetree 1.9.9 / 1.9.10 – Authentication window appears then ST crashes
fields.summary: embedded git-lfs install

fields.description:
One of our programming teachers wants to use your program for students. I am having trouble making it work for them because I install it, it works but the next student that logs in with their account it doesn't. Every student that logs in is always a different computer so anything installed to their Appdata folder the program looks for isn't there the next time. Is there some way of configuring the install of your S/W to work on student type machines?

 

re: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5565
fields.summary: Installation for student type machines

fields.description:
The Staged Selected button is very often disabled even when a file is selected:

!image-2016-12-16-14-21-51-654.png|width=541,height=180!

This can usually be reproduced by staging a file, then unstage it.
fields.summary: The Staged Selected button is very often disabled even when a file is selected

fields.description:
The diff view very often shows nothing even when a file is selected:

!image-2016-12-16-14-17-31-614.png|width=480,height=244!

This usually happens when you just clicked "Stage Selected"

If you click on another the file, the diff shows again. But if you only have one file for both the staged/unstaged area, you're out of luck and need to Unstage/Restage the file for the diff to show up.
fields.summary: The diff view very often shows nothing even when a file is selected

fields.description:
Every time I upgrade SourceTree, it leaves behind an entry in the Programs and Features list:

!image-2016-12-16-14-13-52-809.png!
fields.summary: Upgrading SourceTree leaves behind entries in Programs and Features

fields.description:
Every time I start up the app it's giving me the SpellCheck error dialog, even after clicking Yes every time.:

 

!image-2016-12-16-14-11-01-013.png!
fields.summary: SpellCheck error always dialog pops up on startup

fields.description: I use source tree with a lot of projects and it would be awesome if I could easily filter the items displayed in the bookmark view based on whatever I type (words in project name).
fields.summary: Bookmark search/filter
repository

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Manually pin SourceTree to the start menu.
 # Manually unpin SourceTree from the taskbar if it is there.
 # Wait for SourceTree to be automatically updated! (Maybe a manual update would have the same effect.)

Result:
 * SourceTree is unpinned from the start menu.
 * SourceTree is pinned to the taskbar.

Expected behavour:

Debatable. Pinning SourceTree to the taskbar without soliciting a user preference is not new.  I don't like it myself, though presumably others appreciate it.

The problem, which is new, is that the installer is removing the shortcut I manually pinned to the start menu.  The expected behaviour this that this should not happen, irrespective of whether SourceTree should be pinned to the task bar.
fields.summary: SourceTree update removes pinned start menu shortcut

fields.description: There used to be a link to the SourceTree JIRA in the Help menu, this is now gone but I think it would be quite useful to get back. There now is a link to the "SourceTree support website" ([https://support.atlassian.com/help/)] which direkts you at the customer support portal ([https://support.atlassian.com/customer/servicedesk-portal?utm_source=landingpage)] to report a bug, which is kinda weird. I would think the JIRA tracker is the preferred place?
fields.summary: Missing "Report a bug" link

fields.description: When you update SourceTree, the width of the column marked in the screenshots gets reset. I feel like it should have a minimum width that makes the word "working copy" always fit since it will always will be there and having a horizontal scrollbar here looks weird.
fields.summary: Git branch/status column does not preserve width across upgrades

fields.description: When cloning or pulling from a git repo that contains submodules (links to other repos), it prompts me for credentials for those submodules each time it hits one.  The problem is that the Authenticate dialog pops up underneath the main window so I can't see it unless I move the main window or look at the launch bar for windows and see a second SourceTree window there.  If I don't notice it has popped up quick enough, the operation will time out.
fields.summary: Authenticate window pops up behind main window when using git submodules

fields.description:
Whenever I open SourceTree the pane that shows FILE STATUS, BRANCHES etc. is always way too small and has to be manually adjusted. But annoyingly, it always forgets the setting when closed.

I'm using a MacBook with a HDPI display, but work on a single external monitor with the internal display turned off. The external monitor is a 24" 1080p model.

Currently using Mercurial source control.
fields.summary: Size of status/branch pane is always way too small

fields.description:
When using the CLI to launch Sourcetree, if you already have SourceTree open, then it doesn't open the repository specified in the command line.

For example, run the following (starting with source tree closed):

1.) sourcetree.exe -f C:\repo1 log
2.) sourcetree.exe -f C:\repo2 log

after the first step above, sourcetree will open, to the repo1 repository with the log view open, but when running the second command with sourcetree still open (from the operation of the first command), the repo2 repository is *NOT* opened.

I expected that a new tab would have been opened for the repo2 repository leaving the repo1 tab open/alone
fields.summary: Command line interface doesn't work as described

fields.description:
The current situation how tags are displayed is not optimal. Over time, the number of tags of a project is growing. The current version of the software just allows to fold or unfold the tag section. The unfolded tag section will "push down" the remotes and submodule section, often below the visible area. So for projects with a large number of tags, there is no choice and the really useful tag section has to stay closed.

Nevertheless the user is interested in the tags of a project:
 * The most recent tags of a project are usually of a greater interest as really old ones.
 * The tags usually follow a standardised version schema.

Therefore I suggest the following improvement to keep the sidebar of the repository useful and allow an expanded tag section even for large projects with lots of tags:
 * Show only the most recent 20 tags and at the end a clickable "more..." which will show the rest of the tags.
 * Or show only the most recent 20 tags and at the end a clickable "all tags..." which opens a dialogue/view with all tags.
 * Automatically group tags with the common version numbering scheme [prefix][major].[minor].[revision]
 ** For the latest major version, group to the minor version.
 ** For all other major version, group to the major version.
 * Make this limit/grouping customisable in the preferences.
fields.summary: Add tag grouping/filtering to the repository view.

fields.description:
Updating to 1.9.9.20 broke the external diff/merge functionality. The application simply does not launch at all. I use Meld for diff/merge. I have Meld on my PATH, so settings are

meld $LOCAL $REMOTE

Related: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/44906131/launch-external-merge-tool-does-not-actually-launch-anything-]

Also possibly related: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/44919486/sourcetree-1.9.9.20-breaks-path-environment-variable]
fields.summary: External Diff/Merge not launching

fields.description:
I'm using a GIT hook to run a bash shell script.  To help debug the original problem (Error thrown by NUNIT),  I executed the shell command "env" within the script.

I noticed the "HOME" EV was set twice, difference case, one seems to be window format, the other UNIX.  Note:  X = My Username.

HOME=/c/Users/X
home=C:\Users\X

The duplicate is causing a hashing generation error in NUNIT since it seems to process a list of environment variables.  

I'm just starting to use GIT.  I have no idea where the HOME EV is set, or why there is two.
This is a fresh intstall of SourceTree and I'm using the Embedded GIT 2.10.2
fields.summary: Duplicate HOME environment variables when running the Push Command for GIT

fields.description: If multiple stashes have the same name, clicking one will select both.  The viewer will only select one of the stashes however, the other stashes cannot be selected.
fields.summary: Stash: if multiple stashes have same name, one cannot be selected
Select branch name instead of 'mine' and 'theirs' to resolve conflict.

fields.description:
In push screen from SourceTree for Windows, It would be very interesting if there was the possibility of maximizing or scaling the push screen. Currently it is fixed and does not allow modifications.
Often the branches have longer names and as the screen does not allow adjustment it is difficult to see them.
fields.summary: Allow maximize push screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The 'Show Repository Browser' shortcut used to be 'Cmd+B' in earlier versions of SourceTree. In newest versions, 'Cmd+B' is used as shortcut for 'Format >> Bold' and the one for 'Show Repository Browser' has been changed to 'Cmd+0'. The use of '0' (zero) may confused users, as it looks like the letter 'O'. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the shortcut to something more distinguishable.
fields.summary: Change the 'Show Repository Browser' shortcut

fields.description: I use a Wacom pen tablet instead of a mouse.  The pen's right-click side button does not work.
fields.summary: wacom pen tablet right-click not working

fields.description:
I recently updated SourceTree to version 1.9.9.20, and it seems to no longer be using the PATH environment variable correctly. In particular, my commit-msg git hook is failing with the following message:

`/usr/bin/env: 'python': No such file or directory`

If I modify the script to run as a bash script, and have it `echo $PATH`, I get the following:

`/mingw64/libexec/git-core:/mingw64/bin:/usr/bin:/c/Users/n0030352/bin:/c/Users/n0030352/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/gitflow_local/gitflow:/bin:/mingw32/bin:/mingw64/bin:/c/Program Files (x86)/Atlassian/SourceTree/tools:/c/Users/n0030352/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_extras`

I get this error using both embedded and system git.

However, if I use the git terminal out of SourceTree, I get the correct PATH variable output, none of which contains SourceTree. I can also commit just fine.

So my guess is that the PATH variable output by SourceTree contains application-specific modification to the PATH variable, which fails to include the rest of the paths. For now I am just going to use 1.9.6.2 ([https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTreeSetup_1.9.6.2.exe]).

 

*Potential workaround:*
{code:java}
You may need to make node available in a location which is already on the default system path, like `/usr/local/bin`, or you need to add a custom entry to $PATH in a way that can been seen by Mac Apps, not just your terminal. Here's how to do so: http://stackoverflow.com/a/26586170


{code}
fields.summary: Customer report: SourceTree 1.9.9.20 breaks PATH environment variable

fields.description:
after update to 1.9.9.20, it tooks extremely long time to stage or unstage some files.

note that I'm always up to date with SourceTree, so the previous version would be 1.9.6.2 which was doing better performance with this subject.

please fix this I'm Suffocating now T_T
fields.summary: Super slow when staging files

Trying to revert a merge commit appears to require extra flags. I get the below error.

error: Commit 9630e8dcb8f2a1cc656097f8cce35e2c1a268dda is a merge but no -m option was given.
fatal: revert failed

This is a direct copy of the same issue from the Mac project: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-2034

There is also an improvement request which hasn't been updated in 2 years: 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1832

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users may sometimes work with a large number files and may want to stage and commit them gradually.
If they accidentally hit {{Stage all}}, then all the work they've done in selecting which files to stage gets lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a confirmation dialog that asks the user to confirm if they want to stage all the files.

Disappearing commit button

fields.description:
SourceTree uses fixed size tabs for the repository names.
 Long repository names, e.g. "ISC-2 App (Cube1)" showing only "ISC-2 App (...", are abbreviated in the tabs. If there is a second repository, that has a name that only differs after the dots, it is not possible to distinguish between the two repositories.
 I would expect that at least a tooltip be displayed with the full name or maybe the current repository name in the title bar.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not show long repository names in tabs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers may sometimes want to check if an issue they experience is a bug that has already been reported. They may not be aware of our public issue tracker, in order to search there. They check SourceTree website, https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/, but there is no reference to https://jira.atlassian.com/

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a link for https://jira.atlassian.com/ in SourceTree website 

h3. Why this is important
This way, customers can easily find the issue tracker and search for reported bugs over there.
fields.summary: Add a link to the issue tracker in SourceTree website

fields.description:
Everytime I open SourceTree I get this error message:
{quote}*SpellChecker Error*

SourceTree detected the following invalid Dictionary file references.
 These are known to cause performance issues.

Do you want to remove these invalid dictionaries?

[ Yes ] [ No ]
{quote}
 Pressing "Yes" open SourceTree normally but the error appears the next time I open SourceTree.

How to solve it?
fields.summary: SpellChecker Error

fields.description: I like to use the bookmark bar folders to organize my repositories, as well as giving each bookmarked repository a short name so that I know what I'm looking at in the tab header. I would like to have an option to view the bookmark folder name in the tab header as well, so it might look something like "App Core\Component A" without having to name each repository after it's bookmark folder.
fields.summary: Show bookmark folder name in tab header

fields.description:
When running an interactive rebase, if an error occurs during the "startup" portion of the interactive rebase - after clicking "Ok" in the dialog but before anything actually occured - the entire rebase is aborted.

So everything has to be done again from scratch. Better would be to reopen the dialog and allow the user to change the steps or similar.

This is especially annoying due to the index.lock bug SRCTREEWIN-5639 often causing the interactive rebase to fail.
fields.summary: Error while starting interactive rebase cancels it

fields.description:
Every time after computer wakes up from Stand by mode in the morning, some texts bellow the buttons disappear. After ST restart all is OK again.

Screenshot attached
fields.summary: Buttons' texts disappear

fields.description:
Repro steps:

Given I am Windows user with multiple git repositories open
When I switch between open repository tabs
Then SourceTree freezes up for over a minute

Solution:

Tools -> Options -> Un-check spell check commit messages.

Seems to me like you guys are possibly re-loading the spell checking dictionary or something any time the user switches between repositories. It's been painfully slow and entirely locks up the UI – not great for usability. Turning off spell check made repo switches instant vs. literally taking over a minute when I have 10 repositories bookmarked (3 open).

Easy fix? Disable spell checking by default in your next release and users will love you. I can accept typos in commit messages; I can't accept unusable slowness.
fields.summary: Customer report: Slow performance changing repositories

fields.description:
Most of the time this works fine, but if there are any issues connecting and logging in, sourcetree gets in an endless loop of asking me for credentials.  This is a problem if I only use an SSH key to connect.  In this case if the remote uses SSH public key authentication, I don't think SourceTree should ever prompt me for user and password, even if SSH authentication fails.  It's very annoying when sourcetree goes into an endless loop of popping up windows for me to click 'cancel' on because I don't have any credentials for the remote other than a putty key.

Note: This happened when I moved my keys and putty agent couldn't find them.  I could not use SourceTree even for local management of my git repositories because the authentication window kept popping up asking me for my password, when there is no password for connecting to that repository (only ssh public key authentication is available on that account).
fields.summary: Login dialog endless loop

fields.description: See attachez. Nuff said ;)
fields.summary: File name truncated (in stage/commit/search view)

fields.description:
In my large git repository, which uses git-lfs for some files, SourceTree hangs for dozens of seconds every time I stage files. Looking at the task manager reveals git-lfs.exe maxing out the CPU while this occurs.

Also, the git-lfs.exe which is run is _always_ the embedded version. However, I have it (also) installed in the system, and "use system git" is selected.

In contrast, unstaging is instant, as is staging in a repository without git-lfs.
fields.summary: Staging files locks UI for long time, waiting for embedded git lfs

fields.description:
Add built-in support for Meld diff/merge tool to SourceTree in the Diff options/preferences dialog.

I currently have to set `External Diff Tool` to `Custom` and the following.

Command = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\Meld.exe"

Arguments = "$LOCAL" "$REMOTE"

The above could possibly do with some back-slahses for robustness?

For `External Merge Tool`:

Arguments = "$LOCAL" "$BASE" "$REMOTE" --auto-merge --output="$MERGED"
fields.summary: Add support for Meld diff/merge tool

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you have only System Git + Git LFS and upgrade to SourceTree 1.9.9.20, SourceTree will prompt you to install the Embedded version of Git and Git LFS. If you don't do so, SourceTree cannot work with the system version of LFS.
h3. Environment 1

SourceTree 1.9.9.20, System Git 2.10.2, Git LFS 1.5.2
h3. Environment 2

SourceTree 1.9.9.20, System Git 2.11, Git LFS 1.5.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Git 2.10.2, Git LFS 1.5.2 in your machine
 # Install SourceTree
 # Open SourceTree and add a local repository with git lfs
 # SourceTree will prompt you to download embedded git lfs:  !Screen Shot 2016-12-07 at 11.07.18.png|thumbnail!
 # Click {{Cancel}}

h3. Expected Results

SourceTree continues to work with System Git + Git lfs
h3. Actual Results

SourceTree shows this message:  !Screen Shot 2016-12-07 at 11.07.32.png|thumbnail!
 Any operations on lfs files throw errors
 Additionally, in SourceTree Options >> tab {{Git}}, the version of Git LFS is not displayed at all:  !Screen Shot 2016-12-07 at 11.07.54.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Install Embedded Git and Embedded Git LFS
 Then, SourceTree will be able to work well with System versions as well
h3. Notes

The workaround may not work for users who are behind a proxy which blocks the download of Embedded Git+Git LFS.
 In that case, the user may downgrade to an earlier version.
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.9.9.20 won't work with System git lfs, unless Embedded git lfs is installed

fields.description:
When updating I got the dialogue attached.

It refers to some _file references_ but I see none. Maybe SpellChecker is the file reference.

Not a big issue. Just wanted to mention.

Pressing Yes continued the installation and so far everything looks good.

!Update Sourcetree.PNG!
fields.summary: SpellChecker Error dialogue referring to files that are not listed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a local branch and commit something
 # Right-click the branch and select "Create pull request":
 # The following dialog appears:
!2016-12-07 09_38_40-SourceTree.png!

The way the dialog is designed suggests that what is labeled ``remote branch`` is actually the *target branch* of the PR.

As a result, we had situations where developers that are not as versed in Git change the remote branch to be the intended target branch (``master``), which in fact pushes the changes to ``master`` and creates a PR from ``master`` to ``master``.
fields.summary: "Create pull request" dialog for branches without a remote is dangerously ambiguous

fields.description:
German is selected but not shown after restarting SourceTree. When i change to french, then i see everything in french.

When you look at: C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\ you can see that the folder "de" is missing
fields.summary: Selected Deutsch as Language but not showing on SourceTree
Upon upgrade to 1.9.9.20, the installer prompts for upgrade of Git LFS, downloads, but opens up a new identical window after hitting "yes" multiple times and never upgrades Git LFS.

fields.description:
The interactive rebase function in SourceTree is very confusing.

For starters, when using "squash with previous", the commit message that "wins" is the newest one. Typically, I have an older commit called "Implement feature X", and then a newer commit called "Fixup feature X". When I squash these two, I almost always want the *oldest* commit message, and not the newest as I get today. I can't even imagine a use case where the current behaviour is desired.

Secondly, and the reason for this bug report is that when squashing multiple commits they very easily end up out of order, leading to a merge conflict and failed rebase. Consider this commit history.
 * Fifth commit
 * Fourth commit
 * Third commit
 * Second commit
 * First commit

Doing interactive rebase on "first commit" here, and then selecting "third commit" and "squash with previous" gives this:
 * Fifth commit
 * Fourth commit
 * Third commit (+1 squashed commits)
 ** Third commit
 ** Second commit

Now, selecting "fourth commit" and "squash with previous" gives this:
 * Fifth commit
 * Third commit (+2 squashed commits)
 ** Third commit
 ** Second commit
 ** Fourth commit

And the same with "fifth commit":
 * Third commit (+3 squashed commits)
 ** Third commit
 ** Second commit
 ** Fourth commit
 ** Fifth commit

This leads to SourceTree starting with applying "fifth commit" to "first commit", which quite likely will fail with a merge conflict.

However, squashing the commits in the opposite order does seem to work as expected (First "fifth commit", then "fifth commit (+1 squashed commits)", then "fifth commit (+2 squashed commits)"). However, given the workflow I use, this is not at all intuitive. I would squash the first (oldest) fixup into the main commit, then the second fixup, etc.

It seeems like this ties into the reversed sort order that SourceTree uses in interactive rebase (git rebase -i sorts the commit with the oldest first, while SourceTree interactive rebase sorts the newest commit first). I understand that it's intuitive to use the same order in the rebase window as in the main commit history, but squashing gets very unintuitive with this order. I would argue that sorting the commits in the order they will be applied (like git rebase -i does) is more intuitive both to people who are experienced with git rebase -i and to people who only use SourceTree (provided that the order of commits is explained in the rebase dialog).

Finally, I just noticed that if you press "cancel" in the rebase dialog, you get an error message: 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c "sequence.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri'" -c "core.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri'" rebase -i --autosquash 953b98728a420d0ff3f4ded5284eb8718d1fe2fa
Could not execute editor

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Squash commits confusing and broken in interactive rebase

fields.description:
Staging changes can have surprising results (and maybe crash)
 * Have multiple changes to commit
 * Use the "Stage All" button
 * Then "unstage" selected files
 * Hit the Commit button in the ribbon

Result:
 * I see a screen with all changes plus checkboxes, instead of the expected split screen (staged/unstaged)
 * All checkboxes are checked, instead of just the selected staged changes.

Then:
 * I uncheck all and re-check the few changes I really want to commit
 * Then I commit these changes (button lower right)

Result:
 * the app crashes (the commit has finished)
fields.summary: Issues with staging changes to commit

fields.description: I have several repositories in my repository tree but only the most used of them I have opened as tabs. If i now reorder the tabs SourceTree does not remember the order after I close and reopen. The repository I opened last is always at the far right.
fields.summary: Does not remember the order of tabs

fields.description:
{quote}Whenever I clone a repository in SourceTree i get prompted to specify the author name and email, i use different settings for each repository. When i specify the Name and Email and click Ok the dialog pops back up and asks me to enter the author so I have to re-enter the same details

- STSP-5440
{quote}
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Tools>Options>Default user information
 # Remove content in Full Name and Email Address text field
 # Clone a new repo

h3.
fields.summary: Author detail requested twice when cloning repository

fields.description: Source Tree Crashes and becomes unresponsive on any interaction on windows 10. After closing it will not restart unless PC is restarted.
fields.summary: Source Tree Crashes and becomes unresponsive on any interaction on windows 10. After closing it will not restart unless PC is restarted.

fields.description:
{{Using BitBucket repository, merging from "File Status" tab does not auto-generate merge comment (Merge branch 'master' of [https://bitbucket.org/repo] into master). Doing so from "Log/History" tab generates such comment.}}

EDIT 1: Switching between these 2 tabs adds comment.
fields.summary: Merging from "File Status" tab does not auto-generate merge comment

fields.description:
SourceTree installer trips UAC dialog even when a local folder (where user has full access) is specified as the install destination.

Please make it so that we (the poor souls behind corporate firewalls subject to restricted policies on local machines) are able to install and use SourceTree.

FWIW, A quick investigation in ProcessMonitor reveals that the SourceTree installer is attempting to call CreateFile on a local non-OS disk that I do not have any access to. I hope this helps.
fields.summary: SourceTree installer should not require admin rights

fields.description:
I have a post-commit hook that runs correctly standalone and from sourcetree terminal. However, when commit is triggered in sourcetree gui, hook is not found

+Sourcetree full console output+

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false commit -q -F C:\Users\Charlie\AppData\Local\Temp\hskguqxg.x1h
{color:#d04437}error: cannot spawn .git/hooks/post-commit: No such file or directory{color}

Completed successfully.

+Hook (elided)+

echo 'Hit post-commit hook'
echo $PATH
curl http://localhost:8080/git/notifyCommit?url=C:\\Users\\Charlie\\Documents\\projects\\src\\github.com\\Cxxxxx\\Driver_xxxxx\\

+Hook output from sourcetree terminal+

$ .git/hooks/post-commit

Hit post-commit hook

/c/Users/Charlie/bin:/mingw64/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/mingw64/bin:/usr/bin:/c/Users/Charlie/bin:/c/Python/Scripts:/c/Python:/c/ProgramData/Oracle/Java/javapath:/c/Program Files (x86)/Intel/iCLS Client:/c/Program Files/Intel/iCLS Client:/c/WINDOWS/system32:/c/WINDOWS:/c/WINDOWS/System32/Wbem:/c/WINDOWS/System32/WindowsPowerShell/v1.0:/c/Program Files (x86)/Intel/Intel(R) Management Engine Components/DAL:/c/Program Files/Intel/Intel(R) Management Engine Components/DAL:/c/Program Files (x86)/Intel/Intel(R) Management Engine Components/IPT:/c/Program Files/Intel/Intel(R) Management Engine Components/IPT:/cmd:/c/Go/bin:/c/Program Files/nodejs:/c/PuTTY:/c/utils:/c/Users/Charlie/AppData/Local/Microsoft/WindowsApps:/c/Users/Charlie/AppData/Roaming/npm:/usr/bin/vendor_perl:/usr/bin/core_perl

curl output
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   167  100   167    0     0    167      0  0:00:01 --:--:--  0:00:01  163kScheduled polling of Test
No Git consumers using SCM API plugin for: C:\Users\Charlie\Documents\projects\src\github.com\Cxxxx\Driver_Txxxx\

(successfully triggers poll on jenkins)

fields.description: I am working with a few different repos attached to different BitBucket accounts.  Every 5 minutes while I have SourceTree open, it asks to re-enter the login information for both of these accounts.  They get authenticated properly and work fine with BitBucket until they decide to log out again.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Select a file
 # Actions > Stop Tracking
 # Select "OK" to acknowledge 

h3. Expected behavior

File is untracked and staged for removal
h3. Actual behavior

Nothing
h3. *Additional Notes* 

Similarly, clicking "Cancel" or "X" to close the dialog causes the file to be untracked and staged for removal

fields.description:
Hello,

My project has a git submodule that has been modified. When committing my changes, SourceTree scans my submodule and detects local changes. It proposes me to review them and I do it.

I decide to discard the changes, and then I am stuck with the change review dialog because there is no close button.

You can see that in attached snapshot.

Hope it helps.

Regards,

Aurelien
fields.summary: Can't close the "commit changes in submodule" dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SourceTree sometimes won't launch BeyondCompare on merge conflicts.

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Windows 1.9.6.1, Embedded Git 2.8.1, BeyondCompare 4.1.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unable to reproduce, a user can reproduce by
# Make sure that BeyondCompare is selected as merge tool and diff tool in SourceTree's \{\{Tools >> Options}}, tab \{\{Diff}} settings.
# Creating a merge conflict in a git repo.
# Go to \{\{File Status}}.
# Right click on the file with the conflict >> \{\{Resolve Conflicts}} >> \{\{Launch External Merge Tool}}

h3. Expected Results
BeyondCompare should be launched

h3. Actual Results
It has been reported that sometimes BeyondCompare won't launch
 
h3. Notes
Additionally:
Right-clicking an unstaged file and selecting \{\{External Diff}} launches BeyondCompare normally.
Selecting an unstaged file and then the cog next to the search bar and choosing "External diff", also doesn't work.
A merge from the command lines launches BeyondCompare normally.
fields.summary: SourceTree sometimes won't launch BeyondCompare

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user switches branches in SourceTree in a repository with submodules, SourceTree checks the submodules by running \{\{git submodule update --init --recursive}}.

For repositories with a large number of submodules, this operation can take a long time. And thus, switching branches takes a long time as well.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the user to disable submodule checks when switching branches.
(At the moment, this option is available for commit and push, i.e. disable submodules check before commit and push).

h3. Why this is important
The operation of switching branches can take a very long time for repositories with a large number of submodules.
fields.summary: Allow the user to disable submodule checks when switching branches

fields.description: Allow rebase on remote branches. This helps because you do not need to checkout or update your local rebease base branch before you can rebase your current working branch. This saves two branch switches and a fetch/pull.
fields.summary: Allow rebase on remote branches
During installation the "Load SSH Key?" dialogue box shows "cancel" instead of "No"

fields.description: This will help to get rid of tags.In our case this is important because we never get rid of any tag because there is always one person in our team wich forgets to fetch tags on fetch or pull and therefore is restoring all remotly deleted tags when the person pushes his work.Making this setting available and setting its default setting to enabled would prevent this immediately.
fields.summary: (Git) Add setting to enable "fetch all tags" by default. Make the default enabled.

fields.description:
If i want to stash new created files, i stage them first, so they are being included in the stash.

So at the point, when i try to stash there are files present in the "staged files" area.

I click on "Stash", give it a description and press "Enter" like usual.

But when there are staged files, the focus now jumps to the "Commit" button, instead of finishing the stash process.

The problem is, that it may not be noticed at first, the "Enter" key is hit again and files are committed.
fields.summary: Wrong focus when stashing

fields.description:
When tracking file with Git LFS we use a wildcard pattern for case insensitivity such as:

*.[pP][nN][gG] filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text

 

This allows us to keep our .gitattributes smaller while still catching all the weird permutations that different software packages use for file extensions. However, SourceTree doesn't recognise these patterns so when we go to add new *.png files it warns users that the files are large and should be tracked in Git LFS.

The work around is to track all variations of file extension cases in use individually and bloat the .gitattributes, making it harder to manage and defeating the point of what we're trying to do.

Is it possible for SourceTree to support better pattern matching for Git LFS file type tracking?
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't recognise wildcards in Git LFS tracking

fields.description: Follow up to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-6614.  The "Cancel" button should be translated to "Abbrechen" in the stash dialogue.
fields.summary: German translation typo for cancel button in stash dialogue

fields.description: There is a typo in the german dialog that appears if a stash should be applied. The dialog contains a checkbox with the description "Nach Andwenden löschen", which should be "Nach Anwenden löschen".
fields.summary: German translation typo for stash dialogue.
Crash on commit

fields.description:
When I have staged changes in a git repo and want to stash some/all, I would like to stash the changes, then undo the things I *really* don't want to keep anymore. This way I have a record of what I _did_ change so I can go back if I wanted to.

So I used the 'keep staged changes' checkbox. But alas, after clicking 'OK' on the stash dialog with this checkbox checked, all my changes are discarded. I wanted to keep them.
fields.summary: 'Keep staged changes' checkbox doesn't work when stashing changes

fields.description:
when I select files and stage them, both in the file status and log/history window, the files are not moved from the modified files panel to the staged files panel.

if i switch to the other tab (from file status to log/history or vice versa) the files are in the correct panel.

looks like a problem of UI not updated.

quite annoying
fields.summary: on git, when I press stage files, the files are not moved to the staged files panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Staging an LFS file with special characters in SourceTree is not working with System Git
h3. Environment

SourceTree for Windows 1.9.6.2, System Git 2.8.1 (+ git-lfs v1.4.3)
 Has also been reported with System Git 2.10.2 (+ git-lfs v1.5.1)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a repository in SourceTree
 # Initialize the repo for Git LFS
 # In menu {{Repository >> Git LFS >> Track / untrack files...}} add .zip files to be tracked by LFS
 # Create a new file in the repo, named 'PerĹ‚a.zip'
 # In SourceTree's {{File Status}} tab, select this file and click {{Stage Selected}}

h3. Expected Results

The file is staged
h3. Actual Results

The file is not staged, and the command is failing with the following output:  !Screen Shot 2016-11-28 at 11.06.11.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Executing the same command in SourceTree's terminal successfully stages the file
h3. Workaround

Using Embedded Git in SourceTree stages the file
fields.summary: Staging an LFS file with special characters in SourceTree is not working with System Git

fields.description:
Could a button be added to allow the last stash to be popped back off the stack, maybe similar to what GitKraken has?  This would make using stashes in SourceTree much more usable.

  !Capture.PNG!

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Button to Apply/Pop Stash
overall performance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After changing _Default text encoding_ to _utf-16_ and restart SourceTree, SourceTree unable to find the path to Git directory (Embedded and Git).

It prompts with a dialog to setup Git/Mercurial. 
All the option (except "_I don't want to use Git/Mercurial_") doesn't work as it will keep prompting the setup dialog after clicking it.

h3. Environment
Windows 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Tools>Options>Default Text Encoding* and change to _UTF-16_
 # Restart SourceTree

h3. Workaround
Click  "_I don't want to use Git/Mercurial_" then change the encoding back to UTF-8
fields.summary: Source Tree doens't recognize embedded git after changing to utf-16

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Staging modified files with long paths in SourceTree sometimes stages the file as 'Removed'.
h3. Environment

SourceTree 2.0.19.1, 1.9.6.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download attached repo: [^TestForAtlassian-2016-11-04.tar]
 # Unzip, and add the repository in ST
 # Open repository and go to {{File Status}} tab
 # You will see a staged file that is marked as 'Modified'
 # Click {{Stage all}}

h3. Expected Results

File gets moved to 'Staged' and remains 'Modified'
h3. Actual Results

File gets moved to 'Staged' but shows as 'Removed'
fields.summary: Staging modified files with paths longer than 260 characters in SourceTree sometimes stages the file as 'Removed'

fields.description: [Screencast|https://youtu.be/cMXQCfsWgQs]
fields.summary: Discard hunk may not works when non UTF8 symbols used in code

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you clone a repository with LFS content in SourceTree, and select in the 'Clone' dialog to checkout the branch with the LFS content (different than master), then the LFS content is not downloaded.
h3. Environment

SourceTree for Windows 1.9.6.2, Embedded Git 2.8.1 + git-lfs v1.2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a repo in Bitbucket Cloud with LFS content in a branch other than master, e.g. develop
 # Go to SourceTree, select {{Clone/New}}
 # Enter the URL of the repo (the issue has been reproduced with SSH cloning)
 # Expand {{Advanced Options}} of the dialog, and select as {{Checkout branch}} develop branch
 # When the clone completes, SourceTree prompts with the following:   !Screen Shot 2016-11-23 at 15.36.58.png|thumbnail!
 # Select {{Yes}}

h3. Expected Results

The LFS content is downloaded
h3. Actual Results

Downloading the LFS content is failing with the following output:   !Screen Shot 2016-11-23 at 15.37.33.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Clone the repository without selecting to check out the LFS branch in that dialog
 Afterwards, from the remote branches, select to check out the remote LFS branch
 This will download the LFS content
fields.summary: Downloading LFS content is not working in some cases

fields.description:
When using interactive rebase and editing the resulting commit message using special characters (mainly skandinavian characters ä and ö in my case) get turned into question marks when the rebase is performed.

For example, "Filtteröintilogiikan muutos" turns into "Filtter?intilogiikan muutos". Same commit message works fine when it used through the regular commit dialog. CLI git also retains the characters.

As a workaround, I can first squash my commits with interactive rebase and then amend the commit to fix the message.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase mangles special characters in commit messages

fields.description: It would be nice to have a search in repositories. Because when I have over 60 repositories sometimes it's hard to find one.
fields.summary: Search in repositories.

fields.description:

After that I tried to upgrade to the latest stable(1.9.6) and beta (1.9.9) version, but no lucky.

 

The log file is empty, so nothing useful.

fields.description: I just upgraded SourceTree from v1.8.2.11 to v1.9.6.2.  Previously, the tab names contained the whole repository name while now the names are truncated.  This was a very bad decision because now I cannot distinguish between repositories which have similar names (same text at the beginning).  This can cause user mistakes as one can update wrong repositories.  Can you please restore the original behavior or at least show the full repository name when hovering tab?
fields.summary: Problem with truncated repository names in tabs

it's bad, mmmkkay?
